intro: Sanchezia pedicellata, commonly known as the hanging basket plant, is a member of the Araceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its elongated, pendulous stems that bear clusters of small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically green with a yellow spathe, and it produces small, white berries. Sanchezia pedicellata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique growth habit.
